notesStmt.note: Imperfect at the beginning and at the end. Last portion is considerably damaged. Some folios are worm-eaten.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: An Arabic commentary on the Pentateuch by Abu al-Faraj Furḳan (volume 2).

collation.p: Quires of originally 10 leaves each, marked in the left-hand upper corner with Arabic words.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Three Naskhi hands of approximately 12th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Pentateuch with Commentary. Hebrew and Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2545.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [211v].
